column1: Tim was in the kitchen, ready to make lunch. Tim wanted to make a big bowl of pasta. The pasta box was full. A bird flies into the kitchen through the open window. Tim starts boiling water to cook the pasta.
column2: Does Tim think the pasta box is full or not?
column3: Tim believes the pasta box is full.
column4: Tim believes the pasta box is not full.

column1: Molly was in the garden, building a birdhouse. Molly wanted to use the pile of lumber to make the birdhouse. The lumber was rough. A kite gets stuck in a tree in the garden. Molly starts to cut the lumber to build the birdhouse.
column2: Does Molly think the lumber is smooth or rough?
column3: Molly believes the lumber is rough.
column4: Molly believes the lumber is smooth.

column1: Rob was at the toy store, looking for a gift. Rob wanted to buy an amazing toy car that he saw in a package. The package was full of toy cars. A child drops a toy on the floor. Rob takes the package to the counter to buy it.
column2: Does Rob think the package is full or not?
column3: Rob believes the package is full.
column4: Rob believes the package is not full.

column1: Henry was at the circus, watching the impressive clown show. Henry wanted to get the clown's autograph. The clown was in the big top. A juggler starts performing near the hot dog stand. Henry plans to approach the clown in the big top for the autograph.
column2: Does Henry think the clown is in the big top or near his trailer?
column3: Henry believes the clown is in the big top.
column4: Henry believes the clown is near his trailer.

column1: Yara was in the park, ready to play a game of baseball. Yara wanted to put her baseball in her bag. The baseball was dirty. A frisbee lands near Yara. Yara plans to clean the baseball herself.
column2: Does Yara think the baseball is clean or dirty?
column3: Yara believes the baseball is dirty.
column4: Yara believes the baseball is clean.

column1: Mary was at the library, looking for a book to read. Mary wanted to find a mystery book from an unknown author that was kept in a special case. The case was locked. A light bulb in the library goes out. Mary asks the librarian for the key to the case.
column2: Does Mary think the case is locked or open?
column3: Mary believes the case is locked.
column4: Mary believes the case is open.

column1: Fred was at the ranch, taking care of the horses. Fred wanted to rescue a dry hay bale to feed the horses. The hay bale was big and heavy. A tractor drives by the ranch. Fred plans to carry the big and heavy hay bale to the horses.
column2: Does Fred think the hay bale is big and heavy or broken into smaller pieces?
column3: Fred believes the hay bale is big and heavy.
column4: Fred believes the hay bale is broken into smaller pieces.

column1: Yara was at the science fair, standing near her project. Yara wanted to demonstrate how her oxygen machine worked. The oxygen machine was off. A balloon pops at a nearby stall. Yara plans to turn the machine on for the demonstration.
column2: Does Yara think the oxygen machine is on or off?
column3: Yara believes the oxygen machine is off.
column4: Yara believes the oxygen machine is on.

column1: Ethan was in a museum, looking at a wild Viking shield. Ethan wanted to sketch the shield for his art project. The shield was hanging on the wall. A child accidentally knocks over a sign. Ethan continues to sketch the shield from where he is.
column2: Does Ethan think the shield is hanging on the wall or in the display case?
column3: Ethan believes the shield is hanging on the wall.
column4: Ethan believes the shield is in the display case.

column1: Fred was at the beach, trying to find shells. Fred wanted to show his friends a special shell that he found. The shell was blue. A beach ball rolls near Fred. Fred starts to put the shell in his bag.
column2: Does Fred think the shell is blue or yellow?
column3: Fred believes the shell is blue.
column4: Fred believes the shell is yellow.

column1: Yara was in her room, making a video for her friends. Yara wanted to show her modest doll collection in the video. The dolls were all in bright colors. A toy car rolls across the floor. Yara continues to name each doll in her video.
column2: Does Yara think the dolls are bright or dull?
column3: Yara believes the dolls are bright.
column4: Yara believes the dolls are dull.

column1: Rita was in the university library, studying for her exams. Rita wanted to use a tidy notebook for her notes. The notebook was new and stiff. A book falls off a shelf in the library. Rita starts writing notes in the notebook.
column2: Does Rita think the notebook is new and stiff or wet and limp?
column3: Rita believes the notebook is new and stiff.
column4: Rita believes the notebook is wet and limp.

column1: Yara was at her lively birthday party, playing a game of pin the tail on the donkey. Yara wanted to win the game by hitting the target. The donkey poster was clean. A balloon pops. Yara tries to pin the tail on the donkey poster.
column2: Does Yara think the donkey poster is clean or sticky?
column3: Yara believes the donkey poster is clean.
column4: Yara believes the donkey poster is sticky.

column1: Ken was in his backyard, taking care of his plants. Ken wanted to lend his friend a beautiful cactus from his collection. The cactus pot was full of soil. A kite lands in the backyard. Ken starts to carefully remove the cactus from the pot to transfer it.
column2: Does Ken think the cactus pot is full of soil or not?
column3: Ken believes the cactus pot is full of soil.
column4: Ken believes the cactus pot is not full of soil.

column1: Harry was at the river, ready for a day of fun. Harry wanted to relax in his large kayak. The kayak was tied to the dock. A frisbee lands near Harry's feet. Harry gets into the kayak to start relaxing.
column2: Does Harry think the kayak is tied or untied?
column3: Harry believes the kayak is tied.
column4: Harry believes the kayak is untied.

column1: Will was in his room, preparing for a camping trip. Will wanted to pack his flashlight in his backpack. The flashlight was working well. A ball bounces into the room. Will puts the flashlight in his backpack.
column2: Does Will think the flashlight is working well or not?
column3: Will believes the flashlight is working well.
column4: Will believes the flashlight is not working well.

column1: Harry was at the park, playing basketball. Harry wanted to throw the ball into the basket. The basket was empty. A kite flies over the basketball court. Harry throws his ball towards the basket.
column2: Does Harry think the basket is empty or not?
column3: Harry believes the basket is empty.
column4: Harry believes the basket is not empty.

column1: Tina was at the farm, feeding the chickens. Tina wanted to give the frightened chicken some corn. The chicken coop door was open. A tractor passes by in the distance. Tina starts pouring the corn into the chicken coop.
column2: Does Tina think the chicken coop door is open or shut?
column3: Tina believes the chicken coop door is open.
column4: Tina believes the chicken coop door is shut.

column1: Nia was in her room, getting ready for a virtual singing competition. Nia wanted to use her new microphone for the competition. The microphone was in a box on her desk. The power goes out in the house. Nia plans to open the box and set up the microphone.
column2: Does Nia think the microphone is in the box or not?
column3: Nia believes the microphone is in the box.
column4: Nia believes the microphone is not in the box.

column1: Val was at her grandma's house, learning to bake. Val wanted to make a perfect apple pie. The pie crust was smooth. The doorbell rings. Val starts to fill the pie crust with apples.
column2: Does Val think the pie crust is smooth or rough?
column3: Val believes the pie crust is smooth.
column4: Val believes the pie crust is rough.
